content: Transferring some of our Middleware to use WIT. Is Witgen still viable for generating wit definitions from structs?

Assuming you mean https://github.com/bnjjj/witgen, this is the first I've heard of it, but based on the most recent commit date, no.

GitHub - bnjjj/witgen: witgen is a library to generate .wit files for WebAssembly in Rust
witgen is a library to generate .wit files for WebAssembly in Rust - GitHub - bnjjj/witgen: witgen is a library to generate .wit files for WebAssembly in Rust
Ahh I see. Any alternatives to this or is it just better to manually write the wit files?
I haven't seen anything relevant pass through Zulip (or elsewhere) :shrug:
That is no problem. Thank you very much Lann!
